Package org.lujza.quiz

Class Quiz

java.lang.Object
org.lujza.quiz.Quiz
public class Quiz extends Object
The Quiz class facilitates a quiz application designed to help users prepare for exams by practicing various topics. This application allows users to select from different themes for revision, choose between practice or test simulation modes, and answers questions accordingly. User performance is tracked and scored based on the accuracy of their answers.

The quiz flow includes mode selection, theme selection based on loaded data, and timed questions with scoring.

  • Field Details

    • scanner

      private final Scanner scanner
      A scanner to read user input from the console. It's used throughout the application to capture user responses to various prompts, including mode selection, theme selection, and answers to questions.

    • pointsCounter

      private final PointsCounter pointsCounter
      A PointsCounter instance for tracking and calculating the user's score based on their answers to quiz questions. It supports adding points for correct answers, partial points for nearly correct answers, and calculating the final grade.

    • mode

      private int mode
      The current mode of the quiz. It determines how the quiz behaves and interacts with the user. Mode 1 corresponds to the practice mode, while mode 2 corresponds to the test simulation mode.

    • theme

      private Theme theme
      The current theme selected for the quiz. The theme encompasses a collection of questions related to a specific topic and is chosen by the user at the beginning of the quiz session.

    • stopwatch

      private Stopwatch stopwatch
      A Stopwatch instance used to manage the timing aspect of the quiz in test simulation mode. It tracks the remaining time for the quiz and can also track the elapsed time in practice mode.

  • Method Details

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args) throws IOException
      The main method that starts the execution of the quiz application. It creates an instance of the Quiz class and invokes its runQuiz method to begin the quiz process.
      Parameters:
      args - command-line arguments passed to the application (not used).
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs during the execution of the quiz, such as loading questions from files.

    • runQuiz

      public void runQuiz() throws IOException
      Runs the main quiz flow, including mode selection, theme selection, and the question-answer session. The method orchestrates the quiz by loading themes, presenting questions, and scoring answers, concluding with a summary of the user's performance.
      Throws:
      IOException - if there is an error loading the quiz data.

    • prompt

      private int prompt()
      Prompts the user to select the quiz mode, offering a choice between practice mode and test simulation.

      This method guides the user through selecting the operational mode of the quiz, providing an intuitive interface for this initial choice.

      Returns:
      the selected mode as an integer, where 1 represents practice mode and 2 represents test simulation.

    • prompt

      private int prompt(List<Theme> themes)
      Prompts the user to select a theme for the quiz from a list of available themes. Themes are presented based on the loaded data, and the user selects a theme to focus on for the quiz session.
      Parameters:
      themes - the list of themes available for selection.
      Returns:
      the index of the selected theme, adjusted for 0-based indexing.

    • prompt

      private List<String> prompt(Question question)
      Presents a question to the user and prompts for an answer. Supports multiple answers.
      Parameters:
      question - the question to be answered by the user.
      Returns:
      a list of strings representing the user's answer(s).

    • getUserChoice

      private int getUserChoice(int maxOption)
      Processes the user's choice, ensuring it is within the valid range for the current context (e.g., mode selection, theme selection). This method includes validation to ensure the user's input is a valid selection and prompts for re-entry if necessary.
      Parameters:
      maxOption - the maximum valid option number.
      Returns:
      the user's choice as an integer.

    • getUserAnswer

      private String getUserAnswer()
      Retrieves a user's answer as a string. This method is used for retrieving user's answer in any format.
      Returns:
      the user's answer as a string.

    • getAnswerList

      private List<String> getAnswerList(String input, Map<String,String> shuffledAnswers, Question question)
      Converts the user's input into a list of answers, validating against the available options for questions with predefined answers.
      Parameters:
      input - the raw input from the user.
      shuffledAnswers - a map of the available answers with their identifiers.
      question - the question being answered, for context.
      Returns:
      a list of answers selected by the user.

    • evaluate

      private void evaluate(Question question, List<String> answers)
      Evaluates the user's answers against the correct answers, updates scores, and provides feedback based on the evaluation.
      Parameters:
      question - the question that was answered by the user.
      answers - the user's answers for evaluation.

    • printIfMode1

      private void printIfMode1(CharSequence format, Object... args)
      Prints feedback if the quiz is in mode 1 (practice mode). This method allows for selective feedback based on the operational mode of the quiz.
      Parameters:
      format - a CharSequence that contains the format string.
      args - the arguments referenced by the format specifiers in the format string.

    • exit

      public void exit()
      Concludes the quiz session, displaying final messages and scores. This method also handles any cleanup or final state changes required.
